nova_utils.utils.anno_utils module

Utility module for all annotation data Author: Dominik Schiller <dominik.schiller@uni-a.de> Date: 21.8.2023

nova_utils.utils.anno_utils.convert_label_to_ssi_dtype(data: ndarray, annotation_scheme_type: SchemeType) → ndarray[source]
nova_utils.utils.anno_utils.convert_ssi_to_label_dtype(data: ndarray, annotation_scheme_type: SchemeType) → ndarray[source]
nova_utils.utils.anno_utils.data_contains_garbage(data: ndarray, garbage_label_id=nan)[source]
nova_utils.utils.anno_utils.get_anno_majority(a, overlap_idxs: ndarray, start: int, end: int)[source]

Returns the index of the annotation with the largest overlap with the current frame :param a (): numpy array of shape (1,2), where each entry contains an interval [from, to] :param overlap_idxs (): aray of boolean values where a is overlapping the interval [start, end] (as returned by get _get_overlap()) :param start (): start of the interval to check :param end (): end of the interval to check

Returns:

nova_utils.utils.anno_utils.get_overlap(a: ndarray, start: int, end: int)[source]

Calculating all overlapping intervals between the given array of time intervals and the interval [start, end] :param a (): numpy array of shape (n,2), where each entry contains an interval [from, to] :param start (): start time of the interval to check in ms :param end (): end time of the interval of the interval to check in ms

Returns: Numpy array with boolean values. The array is true where the interval specified in a overlaps [start, end]

nova_utils.utils.stream_utils module

Utility module for processing stream data Author: Dominik Schiller <dominik.schiller@uni-a.de> Date: 21.8.2023

nova_utils.utils.stream_utils.milli_seconds_to_sample_nr(time_ms: int, sr: float) → float[source]

Calculates the specific sample number in a data stream that corresponds to a given time :param sr: The sample rate of the data stream :type sr: float :param time_ms: The timestamp of the sample in milliseconds :type time_ms: int

Returns:

Unrounded index of the sample in the stream for a given time

Return type:

float

nova_utils.utils.stream_utils.sample_nr_to_milli_seconds(sample_nr: float, sr: float) → float[source]

Calculates the specific time in milli in a data stream that corresponds to given sample number :param sample_nr: The unrounded sample number. Might represent a value between to actual samples of the stream. :type sample_nr: float :param sr: The average numbers of samples per second. :type sr: float

Returns:

float: Unrounded time representation of sample_nr specified in milliseconds

nova_utils.utils.stream_utils.sample_nr_to_seconds(sample_nr: float, sr: float) → float[source]

Calculates the specific time in seconds in a data stream that corresponds to given sample number :param sample_nr: The unrounded sample number. Might represent a value between to actual samples of the stream. :type sample_nr: float :param sr: The average numbers of samples per second. :type sr: float

Returns:

Unrounded time representation of sample_nr specified in seconds

Return type:

float

nova_utils.utils.stream_utils.seconds_to_sample_nr(time_s: float, sr: float) → float[source]

Calculates the specific sample number in a data stream that corresponds to a given time :param sr: The sample rate of the data stream :type sr: float :param time_s: The timestamp of the sample in seconds :type time_s: float

Returns:

Unrounded index of the sample in the stream for a given time

Return type:

float

nova_utils.utils.stream_utils.time_to_sample_interval(start_time_ms: int, end_time_ms: int, sr: float) → tuple[int, int][source]

Calculates the start and end sample number of a sliding window. :param start_time_ms: Start time of the window in milliseconds :type start_time_ms: int :param end_time_ms: End time of the window in milliseconds :type end_time_ms: int :param sr: Sample rate of the data stream :type sr: float

Returns:

First and last sample number of the window

Return type:

tuple[int, int]

nova_utils.utils.type_definitions module

class nova_utils.utils.type_definitions.LabelDType(value)[source]

Bases: Enum

Predefined label types for different annotation schemes.

CONTINUOUS = dtype([('score', '<f4'), ('conf', '<f4')])
DISCRETE = dtype([('from', '<i4'), ('to', '<i4'), ('id', '<i4'), ('conf', '<f4')])
FREE = dtype([('from', '<i4'), ('to', '<i4'), ('name', 'O'), ('conf', '<f4')])
class nova_utils.utils.type_definitions.SSIFileType(value)[source]

Bases: Enum

An enumeration.

BINARY = 1
BIN_LZ4 = 3
UNDEF = 0
class nova_utils.utils.type_definitions.SSILabelDType(value)[source]

Bases: Enum

Predefined label types for different annotation schemes as used in SSI.

CONTINUOUS = dtype([('score', '<f4'), ('conf', '<f4')])
DISCRETE = dtype([('from', '<f8'), ('to', '<f8'), ('id', '<i4'), ('conf', '<f4')])
FREE = dtype([('from', '<f8'), ('to', '<f8'), ('name', 'O'), ('conf', '<f4')])
